suggested materials cotton thread 50g/246 yards per skein 1 5 mm hook yardage 90 yards finished size 6 in diameter notes join most rounds with a slip_stitch in the top of beginning stitch unless otherwise noted «in next stitch» does not refer to chain stitches stitch counts for each round are listed at the end of the round pattern repeats for each round are marked with * and different color groups of stitches are listed in parentheses or please read the «stitches & terms» section before beginning all stitches in this pattern are listed and/or explained in this section unless they are explained within the round please refer to this section for any unexplained stitches for a more professional look it is best to wash your finished piece by hand and block appropriately i did my best to make sure this pattern is accurate and easy to understand however if you find any errors or typographical mistakes please let me know if you have questions regarding this pattern or you want to share your finished piece with others you are welcome to join my facebook group crochet designs by nelly klos happy crocheting 2 crochet designs by nelly klos stitches & terms magic loop make a loop with the yarn leaving a tail around 10 cm long make sure the tail end is on the bottom insert hook into the loop from front to back wrap the working yarn around the hook counterclockwise and pull the yarn through the magic loop chain chain slip_stitch slip_stitch rsc reverse single_crochet crab stitch single_crochet single_crochet half_double_crochet half_double_crochet double_crochet double_crochet fp complete the stitch around the front post of the stitch indicated bp complete the stitch around the back post of the stitch indicated starting … crochet the indicated stitch as a matching number of chain for example double_crochet = ch3 tc = ch4 and so on cluster holding back the last loop of all stitches in cluster set crochet the number of stitches into the stitch or space indicated then yarn over and pull through all loops on hook popcorn complete 4 double_crochet into the stitch or space indicated then drop the loop from the hook place the hook in the first stitch of the popcorn set grab the dropped loop and pull it through if round begins with popcorn crochet ch3 instead of first double_crochet in the set sc2-decrease holding back the last loop stitches crochet
